results.title: Magic Michael
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A story film for children, based on Louis Slobodkin’s book. “Michael wasn’t happy just being my brother, he wanted to be something - something or other.” Michael turns himself into anything from a pup to a bear or a chair. This story about an imaginative little boy is told in rhyming couplets, with visuals based on the original illustrations to the book. Storyteller: Owen Jordan.
results.description: A story film for children, based on Louis Slobodkin’s book. “Michael wasn’t happy just being my brother, he wanted to be something - something or other.” Michael turns himself into anything from a pup to a bear or a chair. results.title: Magic in the air
results.brief_description: A simple explanation with animated diagrams shows the basic principles of television. This film takes you behind the scenes of television studios at Radio City, the construction of the iconoscope which is the sender and the kinescope which is the receiver.

results.title: Magic canvas
results.brief_description: An experiment in the use of the animated cartoon as a new art medium employing to best advantage movement, color and music to convey the ideas of the artists. No narration, music only.

results.title: Maggie Mcgowan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Part of series of medical films produced at a London hospital. The camera follows the surgeons operating on Mrs. McGowan as they introduce remarkable techniques in modern medicine to save her from cancer of the bowel.

results.title: Maggie Kuhn: wrinkled radical
results.creator_credit: Howard Weinberg and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Maggie Kuhn who helped establish the Gray Panter Movement in America discusses aspects of old age, human sexuality and medical care. Interviewed by Studs Terkel.

results.title: Madurai of the Naiks
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The Hindu shrines in Madurai, built in the 16th to 18th centuries by the Naik rulers. The Hindu mythology recounted in the multitudinous carvings and frescoes in the temple halls.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jagat Murari, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Madras Kanchi
results.creator_credit: M Krishnaswamy, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The harbour city of Madras and the ancient towns of Kanchi and Mahibalipuram nearby. The history of Madras, its public buildings, crafts, Museum and National Gallery with sculptures and archaeological remains from Dravidian times; the Theosophical Society; music and dancing; Kanchi, one of the seven sacred cities, its masterweavers, its temples with frescoes and sculptures dating from the 8th century A.D.; Mahibalipuram with temples and sculptures cut from solid rock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M Krishnaswamy, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Madhya Bharat. Part 2
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Several cities of Madhya Bharat, including Indore, the chief commercial city of central India, and Ujjain. Shows the many factories in Indore, the cottage industries, temple architecture and modern buildings.

results.title: Madhya Bharat. Part 1
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A pictorial survey of northern Madhya Bharat. Gwalior in all its stately grandeur; its architecture and crafts; Gwalior as a modern metropolis. The towns of Chanderi and Bhelsa, further south.
